How to Install wgaelic on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • wgaelic

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install wgaelic on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing wgaelic on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall wgaelic in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install wgaelic, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install wgaelic Using apt

To install wgaelic in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install wgaelic using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install wgaelic

The installation of wgaelic might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install wgaelic Using apt-get

To install wgaelic using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install wgaelic.

sudo apt-get -y install wgaelic

Install wgaelic Using Synaptic

To install wgaelic using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install wgaelic on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for wgaelic. This will display the wgaelic package in the package window, now to install wgaelic, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the wgaelic package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of wgaelic.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install wgaelic Using aptitude

To install wgaelic on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of wgaelic.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install wgaelic using the command aptitude install wgaelic.

sudo aptitude -y install wgaelic

How to Upgrade wgaelic on debian

If you want to upgrade the wgaelic package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade wgaelic using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade wgaelic to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade wgaelic.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade wgaelic sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade wgaelic

Upgrade wgaelic using Aptitude

To upgrade wgaelic using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade wgaelic.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade wgaelic

Upgrade wgaelic using Synaptic

To upgrade wgaelic using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for wgaelic, now right-click wgaelic, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade wgaelic just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall wgaelic on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall wgaelic from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just wgaelic, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove wgaelic

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of wgaelic

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of wgaelic you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge wgaelic

Remove wgaelic using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall wgaelic using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for wgaelic, right-click the wgaelic package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall wgaelic click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install wgaelic on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade wgaelic using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of wgaelic then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
